bibl.title: Consumption, Trade and Innovation. Exploring the Botanical Remains from the Roman and Islamic Ports at Quseir al-Qadim, Egypt. With contributions by Alison Cox, Rowena Gale, Derek Hamilton, Jacob Morales and Dirk Übel.

series.title: Journal of African Archaeology Monograph Series.

bibl.note: 1. Introduction (M.v.d.V. and D.H.). - 2. Spices - Culinary and Medicinal Commodities (M.v.d.V., A.C. and J.M.). - 3. Summer Crops - From Trade to Innovation (M.v.d.V. and J.M.). - 4. Food and Foodways - Patterns of Everyday Life (M.v.d.V., A.C. and J.M.). - 5. Woodworking and Firewood - Resource Exploitation (M.v.d.V., R.G. and D.Ü.). - 6. Myos Hormos and Kusayr - Different Worlds. - Bibliography. Appendixes (C14 dates; Data tables). Index.
bibl.seg: van der Veen Marijke, Consumption, Trade and Innovation. Exploring the Botanical Remains from the Roman and Islamic Ports at Quseir al-Qadim, Egypt. With contributions by Alison Cox, Rowena Gale, Derek Hamilton, Jacob Morales and Dirk Übel. (Journal of African Archaeology Monograph Series. 6.)
Frankfurt, Africa Magna, 2011, 4°, xiv-313 pp., 104 figg., 58 pll. n./bl. et coul. ISBN 978-3-937248-23-3. €69,80.

1. Introduction (M.v.d.V. and D.H.). - 2. Spices - Culinary and Medicinal Commodities (M.v.d.V., A.C. and J.M.). - 3. Summer Crops - From Trade to Innovation (M.v.d.V. and J.M.). - 4. Food and Foodways - Patterns of Everyday Life (M.v.d.V., A.C. and J.M.). - 5. Woodworking and Firewood - Resource Exploitation (M.v.d.V., R.G. and D.Ü.). - 6.
